skills.name: Quadratic equations
skills.description: Solve quadratic equations by factoring, completing the square, and quadratic formula

templates.hint: Write the quadratic as (x - r1)(x - r2) = 0 and set each factor to zero.

templates.stem: Find the discriminant of {a}x^2 + {b}x + {c} = 0 and describe the nature of its roots.

params.wrongNatureA: {nature === 'two distinct real roots' ? 'one repeated real root' : 'two distinct real roots'}
params.wrongNatureB: {nature === 'no real roots' ? 'two distinct real roots' : 'no real roots'}

templates.hint: The discriminant is b^2 - 4ac: positive (two roots), zero (one repeated root), negative (no real roots).

templates.stem: Complete the square for the equation x^2 + {a}x + {b} = 0

templates.hint: Use elimination: subtract a multiple of one equation from the other to isolate a variable.
Substitute y into the second equation, solve for x, then back-substitute for y.
Even degree positive leading coeff → up on both sides
Work backwards from (mx + p)(nx + q) so the product matches the original quadratic.
Even degree positive leading coeff → up on both sides

skills.name: Trigonometric identities
skills.description: Prove and use basic trig identities

templates.stem: Simplify {identity.expr}, expressing your answer using only {identity.showOnly}.
templates.hint: sin²θ + cos²θ = 1

templates.stem: Which identity correctly expresses tan(theta) in terms of sin(theta) and cos(theta)?
templates.hint: tan(theta) is defined as sin(theta) divided by cos(theta).

skills.name: Statistical inference
skills.description: Confidence intervals and hypothesis testing basics

templates.stem: A sample of size {n} has mean {mean} and standard deviation {sd}. Using z = 1.96, what is the margin of error for a 95% confidence interval for the population mean? Give your answer to 2 decimal places.
templates.hint: Margin of error = z * (sd / sqrt(n)). Use z = 1.96 for 95% confidence.

skills.name: Trigonometric exact values
skills.description: Find exact values of trig ratios for special angles

templates.stem: Find the exact value of sin({angle}°).
templates.hint: Recall sin(30°)=1/2, sin(45°)=sqrt(2)/2, sin(60°)=sqrt(3)/2.

templates.stem: Find the inverse of the matrix [[{a},{b}],[{c},{d}]].
templates.hint: For [[a,b],[c,d]], inverse = (1/(ad-bc))[[d,-b],[-c,a]]. Ensure ad - bc ≠ 0.

skills.name: Normal distribution
skills.description: Calculate probabilities using the normal distribution

templates.stem: IQ scores are normally distributed with mean 100 and standard deviation 15. What percentage have IQ > {score}? Give your answer to 1 decimal place.
templates.hint: Standardise with z = (score - mean)/SD, then use the normal CDF.

skills.name: Quadratic discriminant
skills.description: Use the discriminant to determine nature of roots

templates.stem: For the quadratic {a}x^2 + {b}x + {c} = 0, find the discriminant and state the nature of the roots.
templates.hint: Use b^2 - 4ac: >0 two real roots, =0 one repeated root, <0 no real roots.
Factor {n} into the largest perfect square times the remaining factor, then simplify.
Multiply the radicands first, then extract any perfect square factors.

templates.stem: Rationalise the denominator of 1 / (√{larger} - √{smaller}). Give your answer in simplest form.
templates.hint: Multiply numerator and denominator by √{larger} + √{smaller} to form a rational denominator.

templates.stem: Brand A sells {massA} g for ${priceA}, while Brand B sells {massB} g for ${priceB}. Which option is the better value per gram?
templates.hint: Find the unit price (cost per gram) for each brand and compare.

templates.stem: The parabola y = x^2 - {k} intersects the line y = {m}x + {c}. Find the positive x-value of their intersection, giving your answer to 2 decimal places.
templates.hint: Set x^2 - {k} equal to {m}x + {c} and solve the resulting quadratic.

templates.stem: A particle's position is s(t) = {a}t^2 + {b}t. Find velocity at t = {t0}
Vector A = <{a},{b}>, B = <{c},{d}>. Find A + B
Write equation of circle center ({h},{k}), radius {r}
Given regression line y = {a}x + {b}, predict y when x = {x0}
A biased coin has P(heads) = {p}. What is the probability of getting exactly {k} heads in {n} flips? (Round to 2 decimal places)
Use the factor theorem to determine if (x - {a}) is a factor of x^3 + {b}x^2 + {c}x + {d}

skills.name: Differentiation techniques
skills.description: Chain rule, exponential and log derivatives, trig derivatives

templates.stem: Find area under y = {a}x^2 from x = 0 to x = {b}

skills.name: Applications of calculus
skills.description: Optimization, rates of change, curve sketching

templates.stem: Point of inflection for f(x) = x^3 - {a}x^2

skills.name: Complex numbers
skills.description: Operations with complex numbers and polar form basics

templates.stem: Find the {n}th term of arithmetic sequence: a={a}, d={d}
Sum of first {n} terms: a={a}, d={d}
Find the {n}th term of geometric sequence: a={a}, r={r}
Sum of infinite geometric series: a={a}, r={r}
Find the {n}th term of arithmetic sequence: a₁={a}, d={d}
Find the sum of the first {n} terms of an arithmetic series with first term {a} and common difference {d}
Find equation of circle with center ({h}, {k}) and radius {r}
Find the midpoint of the line segment joining ({x1}, {y1}) and ({x2}, {y2})
